etymologies: early 20th century: from French lipide, based on Greek lipos ‘fat’

definitions: any of a class of organic compounds that are fatty acids or their derivatives and are insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents. They include many natural oils, waxes, and steroids.
shortDefinitions: any of class of organic compounds that are fatty acids or their derivatives and are insoluble in water but soluble in organic solvents
